chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: lb
a: lb

Goal:
a ↓ b ⪯ b

Premises:
lb_meet_mono : forall l m a b : lb, l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ↓ a ⪯ m ↓ b
lb_meet_dec_left : forall a b : lb, a ↓ b ⪯ a
lb_join_mono : forall l m a b : lb, l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ↑ a ⪯ m ↑ b
lb_meet_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> (l ++ a) ↓ (m ++ b) = l ↓ m ++ a ↓ b
lb_meet_length : forall a b : lb, length a = length b -> length (a ↓ b) = length a
lb_join_inc_right : forall a b : lb, b ⪯ a ↑ b
lb_ortho_anti : forall a b x y : lb, a ⪯ b -> x ⪯ y -> b ⟂ y -> a ⟂ x
lb_mask_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ++ a ⪯ m ++ b
lb_join_inc_left : forall a b : lb, a ⪯ a ↑ b
lb_ortho_anti_left : forall a b x : lb, a ⪯ b -> b ⟂ x -> a ⟂ x
lb_ortho_sym : forall a b : lb, a ⟂ b -> b ⟂ a
lb_pointwise_mono_left : forall f : bool -> bool -> bool, (forall x a b : bool, a ⪦ b -> f x a ⪦ f x b) -> f ⟘ ⟘ = ⟘ -> forall l m k : lb, l ⪯ m -> lb_pointwise f k l ⪯ lb_pointwise f k m
lb_mask_equiv_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> l ≂ m -> a ≂ b -> l ++ a ≂ m ++ b
Field_theory.rdiv6 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a b : R, ~ req a rO -> ~ req b rO -> req (rinv (rdiv a b)) (rdiv b a)
Field_theory.rdiv2b : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a b c d e : R, ~ req (rmul b e) rO -> ~ req (rmul d e) rO -> req (radd (rdiv a (rmul b e)) (rdiv c (rmul d e))) (rdiv (radd (rmul a d) (rmul c b)) (rmul b (rmul d e)))
Field_theory.rdiv4b : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a b c d e f : R, ~ req (rmul b e) rO -> ~ req (rmul d f) rO -> req (rmul (rdiv (rmul a f) (rmul b e)) (rdiv (rmul c e) (rmul d f))) (rdiv (rmul a c) (rmul b d))
Field_theory.rdiv7b : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a b c d e f : R, ~ req (rmul b f) rO -> ~ req (rmul c e) rO -> ~ req (rmul d f) rO -> req (rdiv (rdiv (rmul a e) (rmul b f)) (rdiv (rmul c e) (rmul d f))) (rdiv (rmul a d) (rmul b c))
Field_theory.pow_pos_div : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall (a b : R) (p : BinNums.positive), ~ req b rO -> req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul (rdiv a b) p) (rdiv (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul a p) (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul b p))
